page.title: 17CHANGING TIMES CONT'D
page.content: the carrier taking orders into Salisbury and bringing the shopping back. Most people walked or cycled to work locally. There was no shop, apart from the Post Office run by Mrs. Williams. A butcher's van and a baker's van came from Winterslow. People grew their own vegetables and shared them with each other. There were more village activities, such as concert parties, bands and dances. The school was the same and the children played similar games. Mr. Francis Bray remembers riding home- made go-carts down Pitton Hill. They all say more people went to Church then and nearly all the children sang in the choir.
